conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D and pass through baffles to reach containers E, F, or G.
Container E is located on the left, container F is in the middle, and container G is on the right.
Stream A (green) originates from the top left and flows downward, encountering the brown slanted barrier.

premise: Stream A strikes the brown slanted barrier and is deflected to the right.
conclusion: Stream A moves to the right and slightly downward after hitting the brown barrier.

premise: Stream A moves to the right and slightly downward after hitting the brown barrier.
conclusion: Stream A flows into container E.
Stream B (purple) originates from the top middle and flows downward, encountering the purple slanted barrier.

premise: Stream B hits the purple slanted barrier and is deflected to the left.
conclusion: Stream B moves to the left and slightly downward after hitting the purple barrier.

premise: Stream B moves to the left and slightly downward after hitting the purple barrier.
conclusion: Stream B flows into container F.
Stream C (blue) originates from the top right and flows downward, encountering the yellow baffle.
Stream D (pink) originates from the top far right and flows downward, encountering the yellow baffle.

premise: Stream C and D impact the yellow baffle and turn left.
conclusion: Streams C and D mix and move to the left and slightly downward after hitting the yellow baffle.

premise: Streams C and D mix and move to the left and slightly downward after hitting the yellow baffle.
conclusion: Streams C and D flow into container F.

conclusion: Most mixture of A, B, C, and D ends in container F.

premise: Stream A moves to the right and slightly downward after hitting the brown barrier.
conclusion: A thin stream of mixture from A, B, and C ends in container E.

conclusion: No stream ends in container G.
